item.title: Install Ruby 3 and Jekyll on Apple Silicon
item.description: If you would like to start your journey with Jekyll but need the latest version of Ruby to run your gems, you will need to install Ruby in a slightly tricky way. Unfortunately, MacOS, by default, has an old and unsupported version of Ruby (2.6.6). To update it, you will need to take a few steps (a simple installation of Ruby is not sufficient).
